availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Tyler. Married to Lydda Tyler. Father of John Tyler, Sarah Tyler, Mary Tyler, and James Tyler. Clerk in Jefferson County in 1850. Farmer in Marion County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District no. 2, p. 202. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District no. 1, p. 558. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District no. 1, p. 489-490. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, Precinct 2, p. 218.
